step_feedback.feedback: Good job sitting or standing comfortably. Keep your shoulders relaxed.
Nicely done placing hands on your abdomen. Ensure they are resting gently.
You're doing great inhaling through your nose and tightening your body. Try to keep your wrists a bit more relaxed to improve fluid visualization.
Excellent job exhaling through your mouth and relaxing. Focus on keeping your wrists still to enhance the visualization of pushing fluid out.
Second rep, starting strong and comfortable. Maintain relaxed shoulders.
Hands are well-placed on your abdomen. Continue with gentle pressure.
Great inhale and body tightening. For better results, try to relax your wrists more as you visualize fluid moving.
Fantastic exhale and relaxation. Keep those wrists steady to maximize the fluid-pushing visualization.

exercise_summary: You did a great job with the deep breathing exercises! Remember to inhale through your nose, tighten your body, and visualize fluid moving to your chest. Then, exhale through your mouth, relax, and visualize pushing fluid out. Keep practicing this to help your lymphatic system.
